result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Allen Benson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain FTE/schooling or a combination and when not fully engaged, must complete 10 hours of community service per week.
No contact with H.K. until completion of SAFE program and only with approval of the agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Enroll in and complete the SAFE program.  DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: FTE/schooling/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from controlled substances/alcohol and no possession of them except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.

AODA (if not already done).  

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department. 

Payment of any unpaid financial obligations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:36 am 
IN 17CF661, 16CM2411, 16CF99, AND 15CF1215. 
State appears by ADA Chris Plaunt; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Andrew Boden. 

PLEA HEARING IN 17CF661 AND 16CM2411. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State moves to: 
In 17CF661: Ct. 2 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs/PTAC)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 3 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/PTAC)>>D&RI. 
                    : Ct. 4 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: 
In 17CF6661: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/PTAC)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 16CM2411: Ct. 1 (Retail Theft/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 17CF661: Ct. 1>>SWH for 2 years probation. 
In 16CM2411: Ct. 1>>SWH for 1 year probation. 
COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of probation>> assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from controlled substances/alcohol and no possession of them except prescriptions taken as prescribed; fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; pay $289.97 restitution to Target at a rate of at least $30 per month; CC including DNA surcharge (sample already on file). 
COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked in 17CF661 and 16CM2411.
COURT ORDERS probationary periods CONSECUTIVE to imprisonment. 

SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION IN 16CF99 AND 15CF1215. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 16CF99: Ct. 1>>2.5 years imprisonment - 1.5 years IC and 1 year ES - with 370 days credit. 
                 : Ct. 5>>2.5 years imprisonment - 1.5 years IC and 1 year ES - with 370 days credit. 
                 : Ct. 8>>9 months MCJ with 370 days credit. 
In 15CF1215: Ct. 1>>2.5 years imprisonment - 1.5 years IC and 1 year ES - with 370 days credit.  
COURT ORDRES as CONDITIONS OF ES>>AODA (if not already done); assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from controlled substances/alcohol and no possession of them except prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; payment of unpaid financial obligations incurred during probation. 
COURT ORDERS periods of imprisonment to run CONCURRENT. 
COURT finds the def eligible for CIP and SAP. 

Adj: 10:02 am
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 9, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 18, 2017 at 09:45 am.
